title: 6 Gardening Tips and Trick for Beginners

tasks.task: Engage in gardening activities to start a summer garden.
subtasks: Choose a sunlit spot for the garden, considering the space and the growth habits of the intended crops.
Select appropriate crops for the local ecosystem, considering native plants and companion planting.
Arrange plants using companion planting techniques, such as grouping tomatoes with basil or sage.
Ensure pollinators, like sunflowers and marigolds, are included in the garden to facilitate pollination.
Determine the best growing medium (container, raised beds, or in-ground) and select suitable soil.
Set up a watering system, preferably in the morning or evening, to ensure proper hydration without evaporation.

tasks.task: Manage potential gardening challenges and maintain a positive attitude.
subtasks: Prepare for possible setbacks, learn from failures, and continue gardening despite obstacles.
